column4: hey... im trying to get data from a HD i made unbootable while trying to get mac osx snow leopard installed ... gparted displays the partitions but i cant mount
what error dies it give when you try to mount the partition?
wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sdb
how did you attempt to mount the volume?
mount -t hfsplus /dev/sdb /media/martin
you want to specify a partition, not a whole disk, right?
maybe useful: gparted displays 3 partitions but i only have sdb1 in /dev
the partition i want to use is not listed in /dev
and if you specify it manually? also, what does fdisk say?
fdisk -l ?
(i dont want to format my disk accidentially)
yes indeed
it says /dev/sdb is GPT and that fdisk doesnt support GPT
(GUID Partition Table)
what happens when you try to mount the device you do get in /dev?
i tried sdb and sdb1 - same error
any ideas?
might be easiest trying to access the device from OS X, and copy the data from there.
unfortunately thats not possible since i dont have access to any osx comp
this might be of some use to you: http://www.haiku-os.org/articles/2009-11-18_multiboot_installation_gpt_disk
in particular, have a look at gptsync. never used it myself, but maybe it can get you out of your difficulty.
